snippet: The grand boulevard, overrun with clothing outlets and burger joints, has largely lost its distinctive character and has become less French.
abstract: Boulevard of Champs-Elysees, avenue that has long played a central role in France, has become overrun with American clothing outlets and burger joints and has largely lost its distinctive character and has become less French.

byline.contributor: Elvire Camus and Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The grand boulevard, overrun with clothing outlets and burger joints, has largely lost its distinctive character and has become less French.

headline.seo: America’s Mass-Market Invasion of the Champs-Élysées
headline.main: The Champs-Élysées, a Mall of America
headline.print_headline: The Champs-Élysées, a Mall of America
